column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The Art Institute of Chicago is unquestionably a destination worthy of a special journey (and thus an easy five-star review).  The highlight of the museum is in its European paintings
column2: including the very popular "A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte - 1884" by Seurat.  I personally very much enjoyed the Impressionism collection with Monet's "Houses of Parliament
column3: London" and "On the Bank of the Seine
column4: Bennecort."  I also thought the modern art collection had a number of really impressive pieces.  Some other personal highlights throughout the museum were "Market Stall" by Frans Snyders
column5: an African bride and groom wedding ensemble
column6: the Ando Gallery (watch where you are walking!)
column8: Blue Gray Sea" by John Marin.
